title: Brain Games s1 s2
description:
[img]http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/sites/default/files/imagecache/thumbnail_570x321/2013/04/brain_games.jpg[/img]

[b]National Geographic[/b] [url]http://braingames.nationalgeographic.com/[/url]

[img]http://natgeotv.com.au/content/cache/200x200/shows/thumbnails/brain-games.jpg[/img]

[b]Brain Games[/b] is a reality television series that discusses and explores the components of the human brain. 
Hosted by Jason Silva, the show uses experts in cognitive science, neuroscience and psychology. 
The show is interactive, encouraging viewers to participate in experiments, or "brain games", that emphasize the main points presented in each episode. 


[b]Season 1 [/b]

01	Watch This	Explore optical illusions and how our brain can mislead us.
02	Pay Attention	David Copperfield explores how we use attention throughout our life.
03	Remember This	Former detective Greg Walsh exposes memory weakness.


[b]Season 2[/b]

01	Focus Pocus	Highlights our misconception that your brain is able to focus on everything important at any given time.
02	It's About Time	Why does time fly when you're having fun and slow down when you're in danger?
03	Motion Commotion	Explore how your brain use and reacts to motion in order to make decisions.
04	Don't Be Afraid	Explore how fear may actually be good for you.
05	Power of Persuasion	See how marketers, advertisers and even political candidates manipulate your brain to persuade you.
06	What You Don't Know	Learn what you may not know about what's happening around you.
07	Battle of the Sexes	Explores gender differences.
08	Seeing is Believing	Illusions highlight how your visual perceptions can be surprisingly off.
09	You Decide	A team of experts show how you may not be in charge of your own destiny.
10	Use it or Lose it	The brain is similar to muscles - the more you use it, the stronger it gets.
11	Illusion Confusion	Optical illusions highlight how powerful our minds can really be.
12	Liar, Liar	Learn how to determine if someone is lying.
